items.title: Turn input/output node Hadamard wires into wires with Hadamard gates

code.value:
// Step 1: Match the pattern
MATCH (n)-[k]-(m)
WHERE m.t = 0 AND k.t = 2

// Step 2: Create the hadamard node and new edges, and remove the old edge
CREATE (hadamard:Node {t: 3})
CREATE (n)-[l:Wire {t: 1}]->(hadamard)
CREATE (hadamard)-[p:Wire {t: 1}]->(m)
DELETE k

// Frontier nodes with degree two: can be pulled through
MATCH (n {t: 1})
MATCH (n)-[r2 {t:2}]-(m)
MATCH path = (n)-[:Wire* {t: 1}]-(o:Output)
WHERE degree(n) = 2
WITH DISTINCT n, r2, m

// Transformation Hadamard edge into Hadamard gate
CREATE (h:Node {t: 3})
CREATE (n)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(h)
CREATE (h)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(m)
DELETE r2

// Step 1: Match frontier nodes with required structure
MATCH (n {t: 1})
MATCH (n)-[r1n {t:1}]-()
MATCH (n)-[r2n {t:2}]-(x)
MATCH path1 = (n)-[:Wire* {t: 1}]-(o:Output)

MATCH (m {t: 1})
WHERE m <> n
MATCH (m)-[r1m {t:1}]-()
MATCH (m)-[r2m {t:2}]-(y)
MATCH path2 = (m)-[:Wire* {t: 1}]-(o2:Output)

// Step 2: Check they are connected via t:3 edge
MATCH p = (n)-[r3:Wire {t:2}]-(m)

// Step 3: Find unique t:1 neighbors (not each other)
MATCH (n)-[rn:Wire {t:1}]-(a)-[:Wire* {t: 1}]-(:Output)
WHERE a <> m

MATCH (m)-[rm:Wire {t:1}]-(b)-[:Wire* {t: 1}]-(:Output)
WHERE b <> n

WITH DISTINCT n, m, a, b, r3, rn, rm
WHERE ID(n) < ID(m)

// Step 4: Create unfused Hadamard structure
CREATE (n1:Node {t: 1})
CREATE (m1:Node {t: 1})
CREATE (h:Node {t: 3})

CREATE (n1)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(h)
CREATE (h)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(m1)

CREATE (a)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(n1)
CREATE (b)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(m1)
CREATE (n)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(n1)
CREATE (m)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(m1)

// Step 6: Delete fused Hadamard edge and the previous edges
DELETE r3, rn, rm
